column4: For some reason my cd drive isn't mounting automatically. I tried to mount it myself, but it apparentally doesn't have a file system... I tried setting it to iso9660 and it said "mkfs.ext2: invalid blocks count - /dev/cdrom"
What should I do? :|
mkfs? why are you calling mkfs to mount it?
noo... I'm trying to set a file system so I can mount it.
why would using mkfs help?
ok...
is this a blank cd you are trying to write files to? if so you're doing it wrong
no, I'm just trying to get it to mount. There's already something on it
mount -t iso9660
could it be something to do with this?
could that be the problem...?
could be
does it work with other disks?
Here I'll check. I think it's a problem with DVD support, possibly... It's a DVD-R
it does work with other disks.
does this disk work on other machines?
yes
yeah it works with other disks
is your drive a DVD-R drive?
or aDVD drive
DVD-RW :)
so any ideas?
i just said i don't have any more ideas
oh ok
